episodeTitle: The Force That Could Destroy the World! The Power of the Tremor-Tremor Fruit!
description: The Marineford War escalates as Whitebeard demonstrates the devastating power of the Gura Gura no Mi, creating massive tsunamis that threaten to destroy Marineford. Admiral Aokiji counters by freezing the ocean with his Ice Age technique, creating an unconventional battlefield. As the full-scale battle begins, the World's Greatest Swordsman Dracule Mihawk draws his blade to test his strength against Whitebeard.

events.title: Whitebeard Unleashes the Gura Gura no Mi
events.description: Whitebeard demonstrates the full destructive power of the Gura Gura no Mi by punching the air itself, creating massive cracks in the atmosphere and generating devastating seismic shockwaves that ripple through the Marine ranks.
events.significance: First major demonstration of the devil fruit described as having 'the power to destroy the world,' establishing Whitebeard as an overwhelming threat and raising the stakes of the Marineford War to catastrophic levels.

quotes.text: That man has the power to destroy the world!!
quotes.speaker: Marine Soldier

events.title: Whitebeard Creates Tsunamis
events.description: Using the power of the Gura Gura no Mi, Whitebeard creates two massive tsunamis on either side of Marineford, threatening to drown the entire island and all Marines stationed there.
events.significance: Demonstrates the catastrophic environmental manipulation possible with the Tremor-Tremor Fruit, forcing the Marines to respond defensively and showing Whitebeard's willingness to use overwhelming force to save Ace.

events.title: Aokiji's Ice Age
events.description: Admiral Aokiji leaps into the air and uses his Ice Age technique to freeze both massive tsunamis created by Whitebeard, preventing catastrophic damage to Marineford and creating an icy battlefield.
events.significance: Demonstrates the strategic importance of the Admirals as a defensive force and creates the frozen ocean battlefield that will define much of the Marineford War's combat terrain.

events.title: Aokiji Attacks Whitebeard
events.description: After freezing the tsunamis, Admiral Aokiji launches ice spears directly at Whitebeard. Whitebeard easily shatters them and counterattacks, appearing to shatter Aokiji into pieces who falls toward the water.
events.significance: First direct confrontation between Whitebeard and an Admiral, demonstrating Whitebeard's combat prowess and establishing the scale of power in the conflict.

events.title: Aokiji Freezes the Ocean
events.description: As Aokiji falls toward the water, he uses his ice powers to freeze the entire bay around Marineford, creating a solid battlefield and trapping the Whitebeard Pirates' ships in ice.
events.significance: Transforms the battlefield conditions, preventing naval escape routes for the pirates and creating terrain that will be used throughout the battle. Shows the environmental manipulation capabilities of high-level Devil Fruit users.

events.title: Whitey Bay Appears
events.description: The Ice Witch Whitey Bay appears with her icebreaker ship, breaking through Aokiji's frozen ocean with ease as the allied pirate crews advance.
events.significance: Introduces a notable allied captain of the Whitebeard Pirates and demonstrates that the pirates have countermeasures to the Marines' strategies.

events.title: Full-Scale War Begins
events.description: After Aokiji's initial attack, Marines and pirates from both sides charge into battle. Soldiers join the fray and the Summit War of Marineford truly begins with mass combat across the frozen battlefield.
events.significance: Marks the official beginning of the largest war shown in One Piece up to this point, with thousands of combatants engaging simultaneously.

events.title: Bastille and Dalmatian Appear
events.description: Vice Admirals Bastille and Dalmatian are shown among the Marine forces, with Dalmatian in his Zoan hybrid form ready for battle.
events.significance: Introduces two notable Vice Admirals who will play roles in the Marineford War and future arcs, showing the depth of the Marine military power.

events.title: Ace's Flashback and Apology
events.description: Ace apologizes for not listening to his crew's warnings about going after Blackbeard. The Whitebeard Pirates insist that Whitebeard himself ordered Ace to pursue Blackbeard, showing their loyalty and explaining the context of Ace's capture.
events.significance: Provides crucial backstory explaining how Ace was captured and clarifies that he wasn't acting in defiance but following orders, deepening understanding of Whitebeard's crew dynamics and Ace's guilt.

quotes.text: I'm sorry I didn't listen when you warned me not to go after Blackbeard...
quotes.speaker: Ace

events.title: Whitebeard Explains Why He Came
events.description: When Ace questions why they came to rescue him despite his disobedience, Whitebeard simply responds that it was because Ace is his son, emphasizing the familial bond of the Whitebeard Pirates.
events.significance: Reinforces the central theme of found family and loyalty in the Whitebeard Pirates, showing that Whitebeard values his crew members as sons above all else, regardless of their mistakes.

quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Explaining why he came to save Ace

events.title: Luffy's Ship Approaches Marineford
events.description: Luffy's ship with the Impel Down escapees is pulled back by receding water near the Gates of Justice. Jinbe is the only one who realizes what's happening. In a miraculous turn, the water rushes forward, pushing them quickly toward Marineford.
events.significance: Shows Luffy and his allies getting closer to joining the Marineford War, building tension for his arrival and demonstrating Jinbe's understanding of ocean currents.

events.title: Mihawk Decides to Test Whitebeard
events.description: Dracule Mihawk, the World's Greatest Swordsman, unsheathes his supreme grade sword Yoru and declares his intention to test the distance between himself and Whitebeard, considered the world's strongest man.
events.significance: Establishes Mihawk's motivation for joining the battle and sets up a legendary confrontation between two of the world's most powerful individuals, showing Mihawk's desire to measure his strength against the ultimate benchmark.

quotes.text: I want to measure the distance between that man and us.
quotes.speaker: Mihawk

events.title: Mihawk Launches His Attack
events.description: Mihawk slashes Yoru, sending a massive shockwave attack toward Whitebeard across the battlefield. The episode ends as the giant shockwave approaches the Moby Dick.
events.significance: Represents the first attack by one of the Seven Warlords in the war and sets up a cliffhanger showing the immense scale of power involved in this conflict.

quotes.text: That man has the power to destroy the world!!
quotes.speaker: Marine Soldier
quotes.context: Reacting to Whitebeard's Gura Gura no Mi demonstration

quotes.speaker: Aokiji
quotes.context: Freezing the tsunamis created by Whitebeard

quotes.speaker: Whitebeard
quotes.context: Explaining to Ace why he came to rescue him

quotes.text: I want to measure the distance between that man and us.
quotes.speaker: Mihawk
quotes.context: Before attacking Whitebeard to test their power difference

themes.description: The episode emphasizes the familial bonds within the Whitebeard Pirates, particularly through Whitebeard's declaration that he came to save Ace simply because Ace is his son.
themes.symbolism: The entire war represents a father's willingness to sacrifice everything for his son, with the Whitebeard Pirates viewing their crew as a family unit rather than just allies.

themes.description: The devastating abilities of both Whitebeard and the Admirals demonstrate how those with immense power shape the world around them, for better or worse.
themes.symbolism: Whitebeard's title as 'the man who can destroy the world' represents the ultimate responsibility that comes with such power.

themes.description: Mihawk's decision to test himself against Whitebeard reflects the pride of warriors seeking to measure themselves against the greatest opponents.
themes.symbolism: Mihawk unsheathing Yoru represents the respect he gives to Whitebeard as a worthy opponent.

characterSpotlights.role: Primary antagonist (from Marine perspective) / Protagonist (from pirate perspective)
characterSpotlights.development: Whitebeard demonstrates both his overwhelming power with the Gura Gura no Mi and his deep paternal love for his crew, particularly Ace.
keyActions: Creates massive tsunamis with earthquake powers
Fights and shatters Aokiji's ice attack
Declares Ace is his son and that's why he came to save him

characterSpotlights.development: Aokiji shows his crucial role as a defensive powerhouse, using his ice powers to protect Marineford and create battlefield conditions favorable to the Marines.
keyActions: Freezes both tsunamis with Ice Age

characterSpotlights.role: Warlord seeking to test his strength
characterSpotlights.development: Mihawk reveals his motivation for participating in the war: to measure the distance between himself and the world's strongest man.
quotes: I want to measure the distance between that man and us.

characterSpotlights.role: Captured prisoner reflecting on his mistakes
characterSpotlights.development: Ace shows remorse for his actions that led to his capture and questions why his family would risk everything to save him.
keyActions: Apologizes for not listening to warnings
Reflects on his pursuit of Blackbeard
Expresses confusion and guilt about the rescue
quotes: I'm sorry I didn't listen when you warned me not to go after Blackbeard...

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, Tashigi identifies Vista before his name is revealed in the manga timeline
Animation errors show marine insignia misspelled as 'MARIE' or 'MRINE' instead of 'MARINE'
The anime expands on Mihawk's legendary status through additional character commentary not present in the manga
In the manga, Jozu blocks Mihawk's attack with his body, while in the anime he is forced back and then deflects it into the sky

trivia.fact: This episode has a TV rating of 10.4%, ranking #2 in its timeslot when it aired in Japan
The scene at timestamp 14:24 is believed to be the source of the famous 'The One Piece is Real' Whitebeard meme, though the wide-angle version appears to be an edited version of this shot

sources.title: Reddit - Where is the 'The one piece is real' Whitebeard image from?

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapters 552-553 of the manga
The episode features multiple Vice Admirals including Bastille, Dalmatian, and Onigumo, though only Bastille and Dalmatian make their anime debut in this episode
Episodes 279-1070 did not include ending themes, instead using a remix of 'We Are!' during preview segments
